佱字的基本解释

佱
fǎ
古同“法”。

佱字的汉语字典释义

[①]［fǎ］
［《廣韻》方乏切，入乏，非。］
“佱1”的今字。亦作“灋1”。
(1)刑法。亦泛指法律。
(2)指守法。
(3)谓依法惩处。
(4)规章；制度。
(5)指合乎规章制度，合法度。
(6)标准；模式。
(7)常规，常理。
(8)仿效，效法。
(9)方法；作法。
(10)古代对天子御用设备的专称。参见“法駕”。
(11)法术。
(12)相术家指人的面相、手相、骨相等。
(13)我国战国时期学派名。
(14)指历法。
(15)指法酒。
(16)通“廢”。废弃。
(17)通“廢”。大，矜大。参见“法行”。
(18)古代数学术语。指乘数或除数，与“實數”（被乘数或被除数）相对。
(19)助词。用于陈述句、疑问句和感叹句。
(20)佛教语。梵语dharma的意译。指事物及其现象。亦特指佛法。
(21)姓。汉有法雄。见《後汉书》本传。

佱字的康熙字典解释

【子集中】【人字部】　佱； 康熙笔画：8； 页码：页100第15
【玉篇】古文法字。註詳水部五畫。

佱字的源字形

字形对比：

中国大陆宋体台湾细明体日本明朝体韩国明朝体旧字形
佱字的起名意思

暂无。

Yi
Basic explanation of words
Yi
fǎ
The ancient same "fa".
Yi
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［fǎ］
["Guangyun" Fang lacks cut, enters lack, non. ]
The present character of "佱1". Also known as "灋1".
(1) Criminal law. Also refers to the law in general.
(2) Refers to law-abiding.
(3) It means to punish according to law.
(4) Regulations; systems.
(5) Refers to compliance with regulations and legality.
(6) Standard; Mode.
(7) Routine and common sense.
(8) To imitate, imitate.
(9) Method; Practice.
(10) The ancient special name for the equipment used by the emperor. See "French Driving".
(11) Spells.
(12) A physiognomyist refers to the equality of human face, palmistry, and bones.
(13) The name of the school during the Warring States Period in my country.
(14) Refers to the calendar.
(15) Fingering wine.
(16) Pass "abolished". Discarded.
(17) Pass "abolished". Big and huge. See "Law".
(18) Ancient mathematical terms. Refers to a multiplier or divisor, as opposed to a "real number" (multiplicand or dividend).
(19) Particles. Used in declarative sentences, interrogative sentences and exclamation sentences.
(20) Buddhist language. The free translation of Sanskrit dharma. Refers to things and their phenomena. Also refers specifically to Dharma.
(21) Last name. There is Faxiong in the Han Dynasty. See the biography of "Hou Han Shu".
Yi
Kangxi dictionary interpretation of words
[Subset] [Human Character Department] 　佱; Kangxi Strokes: 8; Page Number: Page 100 15
【Jade articles】Ancient grammar and characters. Note the five paintings of the Ministry of Water.
